column1: Table 2. Imprisonment rate per 100,000 person in the U.S. resident population, by race, Hispanic origin, and gender, 2008
Authors: William J. Sabol, Ph.D., Heather C. West, Ph.D., and Matthew Cooper
Table 2: Imprisonment rate per 100,000 person in the U.S. resident population, by race, Hispanic origin, and gender, 2008

Note: Imprisonment rates are the number of prisoners under state or federal jurisdiction sentenced to more than 1 year per 100,000 persons in the U.S. resident population in the referenced population group. See Methodology for estimation method.
a/Total includes American Indians, Alaska Natives, Asians, Native Hawaiians, other Pacific Islanders, and persons identifying two or more races.
b/Excludes persons of Hispanic or Latino origin.
